etymologies: late Middle English (denoting a freckle or pimple): from Latin, from lens, lent- ‘lentil’

definitions: a small, clearly defined patch of skin that is darker than the surrounding skin as a result of an increased number of pigment cells. Lentigines are generally darker than freckles, do not fade, and become more frequent with age

examples.text: a biopsy of the lentigo revealed an increased number of melanocytes

shortDefinitions: small patch of skin that is darker than surrounding skin

definitions: the condition of having lentigines on the skin

examples.text: several members of the family are known to have lentigo
